#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk seabios
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: seabios bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The seabios packages contain an open-source legacy BIOS implementation which can be used as a coreboot payload. It implements the standard BIOS calling interfaces that a typical x86 proprietary BIOS implements. The seabios packages have been upgraded to upstream version 1.7.5, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version. (BZ#1101500) This update also fixes the following bugs: Under certain circumstances, SeaBIOS failed to correctly handle the order of boot devices specified in bootindex. Consequently, the boot devices could start in a different order than defined by the user. A patch has been applied to fix this problem, and specifying the order in which the boot devices start now works as expected. (BZ#1096560) Previously, SeaBIOS in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 filled the vendor and version fields with upstream values that differed from the ones used in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6. This could cause problems when guest was migrated from version 6 to 7. With this update, proper values are used, which do not change after migration. (BZ#1123299) Previously, the "CONFIG_VGA_ALLOCATE_EXTRA_STACK" parameter in SeaBIOS caused 16-bit applications to not work correctly. With this update, "CONFIG_VGA_ALLOCATE_EXTRA_STACK" has been removed from SeaBIOS, and 16-bit applications now work as expected. (BZ#1182634) In addition, this update adds the following enhancement: The Kernel-based Virtual Machine (KVM) now supports dynamic virtual Memory allocation and deallocation. Memory hotplugging and unplugging allows adding or removing virtual memory from a running guest in order to meet the workload demand or to maintain the service level agreement associated with the workload. This functionality also enables rapid reconfiguration of a guest once a workload has been completed or migrated, so the administrator can reconfigure the virtual machine without having to reboot it. (BZ#828571) Users of seabios are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
